item.title: USB 3.0 Offers Gbps Data Transfers
item.description:
The arrival of USB 2.0 as a replacement for 1.1 nearly achieved the universal connectivity goal of its name. With a tenfold speed increase, USB 3.0, or “SuperSpeed,” aims to further solidify USB’s dominance. While the existing 480 Mbps speed of USB 2.0 serves many devices well, surpassing the original USB 1.0’s 1.5 to 12 Mbps, the need for faster data transfer, especially for video, is evident. This need prompted the shift from FireWire to mini-USB in most video cameras...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/usb-30-offers-gbps-data-transfers/
